radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild bibasilar dependent atelectasis; multiple hypodensities in the spleen measuring to 8 mm; normal kidneys with no hydronephrosis; normal abdominal loops of small bowel; no free air, free fluid, or pathologic lymphadenopathy; florid sigmoidal diverticulosis with fat stranding consistent with developing phlegmon and locules of air suggesting microperforation; marked prostatic enlargement to 9.0 x 7.4 cm; stable well-marginated sclerotic focus in the right proximal femur and patchy sclerotic foci in the left iliac; multilevel degenerative changes in the spine.
